data.title: BQ Now Openly Selling The Aquaris Ubuntu Phone
data.text:
Written by Michael Larabel in Ubuntu on 10 April 2015 at 10:07 AM EDT. 4 Comments

Back when the BQ Aquaris E4.5 Ubuntu Edition smart-phone launched in February it was only available in limited numbers via "flash sales" facilitated by the company. At last, now this first Ubuntu smart-phone is available to order by anyone within the European Union.

Now that the early kinks with the BQ Aquaris E4.5 Ubuntu Edition phone are being worked out and other early issues, BQ is ready to offer this smart-phone for sale to everyone -- or at least those living within the EU.

The price remains â‚¬169.90 (about $180 USD). Those wishing to order this inaugural Ubuntu smart-phone can visit BQ.com to place their order.

About The Author

Michael Larabel is the principal author of Phoronix.com and founded the site in 2004 with a focus on enriching the Linux hardware experience. Michael has written more than 20,000 articles covering the state of Linux hardware support, Linux performance, graphics drivers, and other topics. Michael is also the lead developer of the Phoronix Test Suite, Phoromatic, and OpenBenchmarking.org automated benchmarking software. He can be followed via Twitter, LinkedIn, or contacted via MichaelLarabel.com.
